wikipedia_page.main: Monster Bobby (born Robert William Barry, 1981) is an English singer-songwriter and actor, best known as the creator of and guitarist for the indie pop girl group The Pipettes.

response: The Pipettes  were a British indie pop girl group formed in 2003 in Brighton by Robert "Monster Bobby" Barry. The group has released two albums, We Are The Pipettes, and Earth vs. The Pipettes and released numerous singles to support it; the most successful being "Pull Shapes" which peaked at No. 26 in the UK Singles Chart. The group was active from 2003 to 2011.
The female members were backed by an all-male band, The Cassettes, which included Monster Bobby, brothers Jon and Seb Falcone, and Alex White.

The Pipettes were formed in mid-2003 by singer-songwriter and promoter Monster Bobby with the intention of reviving the Phil Spector pop sound and giving it a modern twist,CatOnTheWall.net: Pipettes Interview  after noticing the reaction girl group songs got during his DJ sets.The Unofficial Pipettes Forum FAQ  In collaboration with singer, poet, and photographer Julia Clark-Lowes, who was inspired by Bill Drummond and Jimmy Cauty's The Manual, he recruited friends from and around the local music scene.CMU's Chris Cooke Interviews the Pipettes  The Pipettes, as they were to become, were all first introduced to each other by Bobby at The Basketmakers Arms in Brighton.
*Monster Bobby (born 1981), real name Robert Barry, English singer-songwriter

Dougall joined The Pipettes in 2003 after being introduced to the initial line-up by Monster Bobby at The Basketmakers pub in Brighton. With The Pipettes, Dougall took lead vocals on the singles "Judy" and "Dirty Mind". During her time with The Pipettes, she also provided guest vocals for The Young Playthings, Brakes and Dr Colossus. On 18 April 2008, it was announced in a blog post on the band's Myspace that Dougall and bandmate Rebecca Stephens had amicably left the band "to pursue other musical projects".

Gaps is the debut album from Monster Bobby. The title is ironic in that there are no actual "gaps" between songs on the record. It was released on CD in America on August 7, 2007 by Hypnote Recording Concern, followed by a release in the UK a week later on August 13.
